name: List your notifications

params.name: all
params.description: If `true`, show notifications marked as read.

params.name: participating
params.description: If `true`, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned.

params.name: since
params.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: before
params.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

description: List all notifications for the current user, sorted by most recently updated.

name: List your notifications in a repository

params.name: all
params.description: If `true`, show notifications marked as read.

params.name: participating
params.description: If `true`, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned.

params.name: since
params.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: before
params.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

description: List all notifications for the current user.

name: Mark as read

params.name: last_read_at
params.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

description: Marking a notification as "read" removes it from the [default view on GitHub](https://github.com/notifications).

name: Mark notifications as read in a repository

params.name: last_read_at
params.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

description: Marking all notifications in a repository as "read" removes them from the [default view on GitHub](https://github.com/notifications).

name: Get a Thread Subscription
description:
This checks to see if the current user is subscribed to a thread. You can also [get a Repository subscription](/v3/activity/watching/#get-a-repository-subscription).

Note that subscriptions are only generated if a user is participating in a conversation--for example, they've replied to the thread, were **@mention**ed, or manually subscribe to a thread.

name: Set a Thread Subscription

params.name: subscribed
params.description: Determines if notifications should be received from this thread

params.name: ignored
params.description: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this thread

description: This lets you subscribe or unsubscribe from a conversation. Unsubscribing from a conversation mutes all future notifications (until you comment or get **@mention**ed once more).

name: List Stargazers
description: You can also find out _when_ stars were created by passing the following custom [media type](/v3/media/) via the `Accept` header:

name: List repositories being starred by a user

params.name: sort
params.description: One of `created` (when the repository was starred) or `updated` (when it was last pushed to).

description: You can also find out _when_ stars were created by passing the following custom [media type](/v3/media/) via the `Accept` header:

name: List repositories being starred by the authenticated user

params.name: sort
params.description: One of `created` (when the repository was starred) or `updated` (when it was last pushed to).

description: You can also find out _when_ stars were created by passing the following custom [media type](/v3/media/) via the `Accept` header:

name: Check if you are starring a repository
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.

name: Star a repository
description:
Requires for the user to be authenticated.

Note that you'll need to set `Content-Length` to zero when calling out to this endpoint. For more information, see "[HTTP verbs](/v3/#http-verbs)."

name: Unstar a repository
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.

name: List repositories being watched by a user
List repositories being watched by the authenticated user
Set a Repository Subscription

params.name: subscribed
params.description: Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.

params.name: ignored
params.description: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.

description: If you would like to watch a repository, set `subscribed` to `true`. If you would like to ignore notifications made within a repository, set `ignored` to `true`. If you would like to stop watching a repository, [delete the repository's subscription](#delete-a-repository-subscription) completely.

name: Delete a Repository Subscription
description: This endpoint should only be used to stop watching a repository. To control whether or not you wish to receive notifications from a repository, [set the repository's subscription manually](#set-a-repository-subscription).

name: Check if you are watching a repository (LEGACY)
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.

name: Watch a repository (LEGACY)
description:
Requires the user to be authenticated.

Note that you'll need to set `Content-Length` to zero when calling out to this endpoint. For more information, see "[HTTP verbs](/v3/#http-verbs)."

name: Stop watching a repository (LEGACY)
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.

name: List issue events for a repository
description: Repository issue events have a different format than other events, as documented in the [Issue Events API](/v3/issues/events/).

name: List public events for a network of repositories
List public events for an organization
List events that a user has received
description: These are events that you've received by watching repos and following users. If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

name: List public events that a user has received
List events performed by a user
description: If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see your private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

name: List public events performed by a user
List events for an organization
description: This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this.

name: List Feeds
description:
GitHub provides several timeline resources in [Atom](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(standard)) format. The Feeds API lists all the feeds available to the authenticated user:

*   **Timeline**: The GitHub global public timeline
*   **User**: The public timeline for any user, using [URI template](/v3/#hypermedia)
*   **Current user public**: The public timeline for the authenticated user
*   **Current user**: The private timeline for the authenticated user
*   **Current user actor**: The private timeline for activity created by the authenticated user
*   **Current user organizations**: The private timeline for the organizations the authenticated user is a member of.

**Note**: Private feeds are only returned when [authenticating via Basic Auth](/v3/#basic-authentication) since current feed URIs use the older, non revocable auth tokens.
